Creator: Jon Burton
Description: A true director's cut made by the original game's director. Adds improved controls, bug fixes, save support, a new map screen, new modes, Super Sonic, and much more, all while keeping the original game intact via a menu option.

Original Game: Super Mario Advance 4: Super Mario Bros. 3
Creator: Nintendo
Description: An official rerelease that includes all 38 e-Reader levels, removing the need for an e-Reader. This includes levels that were previously Japan-only and removes the original game's limitation of only being able to store 32 e-Reader levels at once. Available through the Wii U Virtual Console and Nintendo Switch Online.

Creator: Tomato
Description: Makes the game less grind-heavy by doubling earned EXP and money. Originally made for the unofficial EarthBound Zero release, but also works with the official ROM released later.

Creator: Summer Dragonfly
Description: Increases the audio quality and reduces the 'background hiss' that some GBA soundtracks are known for.

Creator: Nikokaro
Description: Replaces the original game's gyro controls with normal button inputs. A small number of microgames are made much more challenging, if not impossible, by this change.

Creator: Nikokaro
Description: Replaces the original game's gyro controls with normal button inputs.

Creator: Nikokaro
Description: Replaces the original game's gyro controls with normal button inputs.

Creator: infinest
Description: Replaces the original game's gyro controls with normal button inputs.

Creator: MojoDodo
Description: Adds color, a level select, high score saving, a bug fix, and other assorted polish.

Creator: marc_max
Description: Adds color, Luigi+Daisy+Wario as playable characters with their own color palettes, and other minor changes.

Creator: korxo
Description: Adds color.

Creator: marc_max
Description: Adds color, removes slowdown, and adds an NES-style pause screen plus other minor changes.

Creator: kkzero
Description: Adds color and other visual flair, which can be changed in a new settings menu. Also removes slowdown and adds a toggle for animal friends' BGM.

Creator: Yoshifanatic
Description: Adds full save functionality with three save files. Also adds a sound test to the main menu.

Hack: Castlevania Adventure Autoboot + Speed + Whip Hack
Creator: richirobot
Description: Autoboots into Castlevania: The Adventure, increases player speed, and makes it so that your whip doesn't get downgraded when you take damage. Separate patches are included for speed, whip, or both.

Creator: ProstatePunch
Description: Re-colors Castlevania: The Adventure. Includes the Autoboot + Speed + Whip hack pre-patched and removes the ability to exit to the game selection screen, effectively making the game Castlevania-only.

Hack: Mega Man World: Dr. Wily's Revenge GBC
Creator: Specialagentape
Description: Adds color (including weapon icons and colors) and reduces slowdown.

Creator: Q
Description: Several names have been changed with the intent of either matching the original Japanese script more closely, or removing ambiguity/confusion. Also fixes some grammar.

Creator: Specialagentape
Description: Adds color, a new rain effect, a sound test, and two optional new gameplay modes: Follower Kong (the Kong you are not playing as will follow you, like in the SNES version) and New Kiddy Mode (easy mode).

Creator: toruzz
Description: Adds color, multiple player sprites, Luigi as a second character with different physics, a new options menu, battery saves, and a bunch of other changes/fixes along with removing slowdown.

Creator: toruzz
Description: Adds color, adds Luigi as a second character with different physics, and removes slowdown. The Bunny Mario Graphics Fix (Stifu) addendum fixes a minor bug that was also present in the original game.

Creator: GreenAndACat
Description: Adds color. Has two addendums: Revised (ShadowOne333) which adds several fixes, and Fluffy Repair Service (minucce) which adds more fixes on top of Revised.

Creator: Prof. 9
Description: Merges many features from the three versions of Star Force together into one game, makes Japan-only content accessible through new means, removes the need for touch controls, adds new side content, updates the font to match later games, and more.

Original Game: Mega Man Star Force 2: Zerker x Saurian
Hack: Mega Man Star Force 2 Not Quite DX
Creator: Prof. 9
Description: Significantly reduces random encounter rates (except when using search sub-cards), simplifies some progression-related requirements, and makes download-related events accessible through normal means.

Creator: Ospin
Description: Reworks/adds several gameplay mechanics to be more in line with modern entries, including Super Rotation System (SRS), bagging, hard drop, hold pieces, ghost pieces, T-spins, and more. An addendum, Rosy Retrospection DX (Creepercraft), adds color and fixes some bugs from the original hack.

Creator: MojoDodo
Description: Adds color.

Creator: kkzero
Description: Adds color and removes slowdown.

Creator: kkzero
Description: Adds color and higher framerates, and fixes an audio bug. Includes two patches; the GDMA version has better performance, but may be buggy depending on the emulator/hardware (BGB or VBA is recommended) and can break multiplayer.

Creator: Specialagentape
Description: Adds color, a time attack mode, unused music, and several quality of life improvements. Press Select on the overworld for a new menu.

Creator: EJRTQ
Description: Adds color.

Hack: Pokemon Red / Blue Full Color Hack
Creator: Drenn
Description: Adds color, resulting in visuals that are very similar to GSC. The download includes both Red and Blue, and there are two patches for each: one replaces the trainer/Pokemon battle sprites and HUD with their more detailed GSC counterparts, while the other simply colorizes the original sprites.

Original Game: The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening DX
Creator: Tzepish
Description: Replaces the text font with the more readable font from the Oracle games.

Creator: Issun
Description: Fixes many bugs, broken routines, and mishandled graphics.

Creator: Mips96
Description: Changes story mode text to reflect Kirby's depiction in later games, and fixes grammatical errors. Download includes an alternate patch that also replaces all references to 'Avalanche' with 'Puyo Puyo'.

Creator: Skelux Core
Description: Adds button controls to all rhythm games. Menus and pre-game dialogue still require touch controls.

Creator: Creepercraft
Description: Adds color, a secret mode, and some easter eggs. The download includes two patches, each with different color variations based on SRS and TGM respectively.

Creator: Capcom
Description: The Virtual Console releases of the MMBN games include several changes, many of which involve making multiplayer or e-Reader-exclusive content accessible through normal means, though there are also minor graphical changes. However, multiplayer does not work. More info
